titleStmt.title: Kvartet for to violiner, bratsch og cello, opus 44

work.title: Kvartet for to violiner, bratsch og cello, opus 44
Quartet for Two Violins, Viola and Cello, Opus 44
Piacevolezza

contributor.persName: Den københavnske Strygekvartet (Gunna Breuning, Gerhard Rafn, Ella Faber, Paulus Bache)

history.p: Nielsen composed the quartet, Op. 44, between two of his major achievements: the opera Maskarade (CNW 2) and the music for the melodrama Hr. Oluf han rider– (CNW 7). The first two movements of the quartet were dated at the beginning of 1906, while the last two ones were finished in the summer. It seems that the quartet was revised several times, between different performances (1906–12) and up until its publication in 1923.

bibl.author: Niels Krabbe
bibl.title: Two newly discovered sources for the String Quartet in F Major, Opus 44, and the Suite for Piano, Opus 45
Carl Nielsen Studies

event.desc: First performance. Carl Nielsen's remark in a letter to Henrik Knudsen dated 9 Aug. 1906 seems to refer to the first rehearsal rather than the first performance: 'Vi har idag spillet min nye Kvartet og den klinger som jeg havde ventet mig' (We have played my new quartet today and it sounds as I had expected).

bibl.title: Inger Sørensen, 'Musiklivet på Fuglsang', Fund og Forskning i Det Kongelige Biblioteks Samlinger, 52 (2013), p. 239

event.persName: Julius Koppel/Ketty Faber/ Frans Faber?, violin

expression.title: Finale
expression.tempo: Molto adagio. Allegro non tanto, ma molto scherzoso
